N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 587.1 - Applicability of this Part

State Regulations
(a) Section
360
of the

Education Law of New York State authorizes the State University to regulate
traffic and parking on State University property through the adoption and
enforcement of rules and regulations. Such rules must be consistent with the

New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law and must be approved by the Board of

Trustees. The chancellor, or designee, is authorized to establish such
guidelines and procedures, consistent herewith, as may be necessary for the
proper administration of State University vehicle and traffic regulations
pursuant to this Part. (b) This

Part shall govern vehicular and pedestrian traffic and parking upon the
highways, streets, roads, parking lots, parking garages, and sidewalks of the

State University of New York, System Administration and other University
property, and shall apply to all State University Plaza personnel and
visitors. (c) The New York State

Vehicle and Traffic Law shall apply upon such premises notwithstanding any
references in such law to public highways, streets, roads or
sidewalks. (d) These parking
regulations shall be in effect at all times, including holidays. Notes
